name: Peer
description: A Peer can connect to other peers and listen for connections.

children.name: id
children.description:
Other peers can connect to this peer using the provided ID. If no ID is given, one will be generated by the brokering server.
It's not recommended that you use this ID to identify peers, as it's meant to be used for brokering connections only. You're recommended to set the metadata option to send other identifying information.

children.name: key
children.description: API key for the cloud PeerServer. This is not used for servers other than 0.peerjs.com.

children.name: host
children.description: Server host. Defaults to 0.peerjs.com. Also accepts '/' to signify relative hostname.

children.name: config
children.description: Configuration hash passed to RTCPeerConnection. This hash contains the ICE servers. Defaults to { 'iceServers': [{ 'url': 'stun:stun.l.google.com:19302' }] }

children.name: debug
children.description: Prints log messages depending on the debug level passed in. Defaults to 0.

name: MediaConnection
description: Wraps WebRTC's media streams. To get one, use peer.call.

children.name: #answer
children.description: When recieving a call event on a Peer, you can call answer on the media connection provided by the callback to accept the call and optionally send your own media stream.

children.name: #on
children.description: Set listeners for media connection events.

children.name: 'stream'
children.description: Fired when the remote peer answers your call. stream is the media stream the remote peer added.

children.name: #metadata
children.description: Metadata associated with the connection, passed in by whoever initiated the connection.

children.name: #peer
children.description: The ID of the Peer on the other end of this connection.

children.name: #type
children.description: For media connections, this is always 'media'.
